data.title: NDP 2024: National Day Celebrations at the Padang & Marina Bay, Heartlands NDP Events, FlyPasts & Fireworks
data.meta_description: Everything to know about the National Day Parade at the Padang and NDP Heartland events for 2024.
data.text:
Here’s everything we know about the National Day Parade 2024. From the National Day concert to flypast information, NDP activities at the Padang and Marina Bay on 9 August, new parade segments, fireworks, NDP heartland events and more!

This year’s National Day Parade is promising to be a big one! With the theme ‘Together, As One United People,’ the 2024 NDP will celebrate Singapore’s 59th birthday with parades at two venues on 9 August—the Padang and the Promontory @ Marina Bay. This means stunning fireworks displays across both areas, promising some of the biggest NDP fireworks yet. Plus, the festivities will extend beyond 9 August with NDP events at heartland locations around the island. What makes this year even more exciting is the introduction of new segments, including a ‘war fighting’ air-land-sea display! Here’s what to expect at NDP 2024, from crowd favourites like the Red Lions, the Presidential Gun Salute, fireworks, and much more.

Read more: Where to Watch NDP Fireworks for Free

NDP 2024 in the Heartlands

Every year, Singaporeans look forward to exciting NDP celebrations all over the heartlands during the National Day weekends. This year, NDP 2024 brings the festivities to five heartland locations on 10 August 2024, each with a unique theme. Head to the open field opposite Bishan Circle Line MRT station for “Unity in Diversity”, the Waterway Point for “One HOME”, FutsalArena @ Yishun for “Moving Forward, Cherishing Our Past”, Paya Lebar Quarter 1 for “Lights Up, Power Up” and Buona Vista MRT Station for “Heart ToGather”.

NDP 2024 Heartland celebrations will feature carnival games, family activities, live performances, static displays of SAF, SCDF, and SPF vehicles, and fireworks! This year, look forward to interactive activities with a local twist.

You can now collect tickets (maximum of two tickets per person) for the celebration closest to your community at your nearest community club on a first-come, first-served basis. Attendees will also receive NDP 2024 fun packs, but only a limited number are available, so be sure to arrive early to snag them while stocks last!

When: 10 August 2024, 4pm – 9pm

Where: Bishan, Punggol, Yishun, Paya Lebar and Buona Vista

How much: Free, but you must have a ticket to join the event.

NDP 2024 at the Padang and the Promontory @ Marina Bay

There will be two venues to celebrate NDP 2024, the Padang and the Promontory @ Marina Bay. The main parade will be held at the Padang, and viewers can expect immersive programmes that extend from the Padang to Marina Bay. Look forward to crowd favourite programmes such as the Red Lions, State Flag Flypast, the Presidential Gun Salute and more. There will also be a few firsts at NDP 2024, including the new Total Defence 40 Dynamic Defence Display, which will feature an exciting air-land-sea display to depict a whole-of-government and community response to various threats and disruptions against the nation. Also to be performed for the first time at NDP 2024 will be the Onward March, where parade contingents will march onto the spectator stands, giving the viewers a more immersive experience.

NDP 2024 Preview and Rehearsal Shows at The Padang & the Promontory @ Marina Bay

NDP Rehearsals: 28 May, 11 Jun, 15 Jun, 22 Jun, 29 Jun, 6 Jul, 13 Jul, 20 Jul 2024

NDP Previews: 27 July & 3 August 2024

National Day Parade 2024 at The Padang & the Promontory @ Marina Bay

When: 9 August 2024, timing TBC (firework timings: around 8pm onwards)

Where: The Padang & the Promontory @ Marina Bay

Even though NDP 2024’s main venue is at the Padang, where most of the programmes will be held, viewers at the Promontory @ Marina Bay will get to enjoy the Total Defence 40 Dynamic Defence Display live, as this segment will take place at both venues. There will also be a sail-past by the President Gun Salute, along with stage performances and a live telecast of the NDP 2024 at the Padang.

NDP 2024 will incorporate exciting new technologies, including wrist-worn LEDs and extended multimedia screens. Additionally, a 360-degree experience of the NDP fireworks will be set up in the areas around the Padang and Marina Bay. This ensures that viewers at the Padang, the Promontory @ Marina Bay, and the surrounding areas will have a stunning view of the fireworks, no matter where they are in the vicinity.

Here’s where to watch the fireworks for free!

NDP 2024 Flypasts

If you’re planning to watch the parade from the comfort of your home, good news! You might still catch the state flag flypast and F-16 jets making their rounds in the heartlands. The Fly Our Flag segment is a highly anticipated part of NDP each year, allowing viewers who are unable to attend the parade to still experience the NDP 2024 celebrations by spotting the majestic jets and helicopters in several neighbourhoods across Singapore.

There will be two routes for the NDP 2024 flypast featuring helicopters with the state flag. The western route will include Woodlands, Choa Chu Kang, Bukit Batok, Jurong, and West Coast, while the eastern route will cover Seletar, Sengkang, Punggol, Pasir Ris, Bedok, and East Coast.

In addition to the helicopters, six F-16 jets will also make their flypast over locations such as Clementi, Jurong West, Choa Chu Kang, Bukit Batok, Woodlands, Toa Payoh, Seletar, Punggol, and Bendemeer.

RSAF Island Flypast: Western Route

When: 9 August 2024, 5:45pm – 6:30pm

Where: Includes Woodlands, Choa Chu Kang, Bukit Batok, Jurong, and West Coast

RSAF Island Flypast: Eastern Route

When: 9 August 2024, 5:45pm – 6:30pm

Where: From Seletar, Sengkang, Punggol, Pasir Ris, Bedok, and East Coast

F-16 jets Flypast

When: 9 August 2024, 6pm – 6:30pm

Where: Includes Clementi, Jurong West, Choa Chu Kang, Bukit Batok, Woodlands, Toa Payoh, Seletar, Punggol, and Bendemeer

National Day 2024 events

National Day 2024 Specials at El Chido

El Chido at Pullman Singapore Hill Street has crafted a special locally-infused menu to celebrate Singapore’s 59th birthday! This National Day 2024, the Mexican-themed rooftop bar invites you to commemorate the nation’s birthday with exciting fusion dishes such as Chicken Rice Chimichanga and Crispy Seafood Otah. There’s also the limited-time sharing Singarita which you can sip on while enjoying the stunning view of the Singapore skyline. On Saturday evenings, you can dine with a backdrop of the NDP 2024 fireworks display. Plus, there will be an in-house DJ to keep the vibe festive and an infinity pool for a refreshing dip!

When: from 6pm daily (Available from 4pm on Saturdays)

Where: El Chido, RF at Pullman Singapore Hill Street, 1 Hill Street, Singapore 179949

How much: $88.88++ per set. Reserve your table here.

Durian Fiesta at Ellenborough Market Café: National Day 2024

What better way to celebrate Singapore’s birthday than by indulging in the nation’s favourite fruit, the durian! For NDP 2024, Paradox Singapore Merchant Court is hosting a Durian Fiesta at Ellenborough Market Café, featuring a delectable buffet spread that highlights the ‘King of Fruits’. Look forward to unique dishes such as Durian Fried Rice and Hokkaido Pumpkin Durian Cream Soup, along with dessert classics like Durian Hazelnut Choux and the signature Durian Pengat. Can’t get enough of durians? Head to the Durian Fruit Bazaar ($138/adult, $50/child), available exclusively for dinner on Thursdays between 18 July and 8 August, and on National Day 2024. Enjoy unlimited servings of fresh durian at Ellenborough Market Café’s alfresco live station overlooking the Singapore River!

When: 1 July – 31 August 2024 (Friday – Sunday), 6:30pm – 10pm

Where: Ellenborough Market Café, Paradox Singapore Merchant Court, 20 Merchant Rd, Singapore 058281

How much: $98 per adult and $42 per child. Reserve your table here.

Edge’s National Day 2024: National Day dinner & lunch

Celebrate National Day 2024 with Edge’s special National Day buffet, where you can indulge in some of Singapore’s most iconic dishes, including a live Kueh Pie Tie station, Bak Kut Teh, Singapore Laksa with Baby Lobster, Bak Chor Mee, and more. There’s even a unique pop-up drinks stall featuring local favourites like Teh Tarik, Iced Limau, Soya Cincao, and a Virgin Singapore Sling! Don’t miss the dessert station with exclusive local treats such as Ice Cheng Teng Soup, Lychee Bandung Compote Trifle, Milo Dinosaur Panna Cotta, Kueh Lapis, and the National Day special, Chempedak Cake. Plus, the ice cream station will offer the iconic sandwich and potong ice cream.

Singapore citizens born in 1965 enjoy a special price of $88 per adult for the National Day lunch buffet!

When: Dinner: 9 July – 9 August 2024, 6pm – 10pm; Lunch: 9 August 2024, 12pm – 3pm

Where: 7 Raffles Blvd, Level 3 Pan Pacific, Singapore 039595

How much: Dinner: $128 per adult, $64 per child (6 – 12 years old); Lunch: $128 per adult, $64 per child (6 – 12 years old). Citizens born in 1965: $88 per adult. Reserve your table here.

The Capitol Kempinski Hotel Singapore: National Day menu and staycation package

The Capitol Kempinski Hotel Singapore celebrates the nation’s birthday with a special National Day three-course set menu at 15 Stamford! For just $59++ per person, look forward to a local take on some of your favourite international cuisines, such as Foie Gras Kaya Toast (smooth foie gras and organic egg foam layered with kaya in a soft brioche bun) and tender prime ribs glazed with an angelica barbeque sauce, which takes inspiration from Bak Kut Teh. There is also the Laksa, complemented by succulent Hokkaido scallops. For desserts, indulge in the Pandan Tiramisu. If you’re dining on National Day, we highly recommend enhancing your experience for $59++ per person to get exclusive access to the rooftop of Eden Residences for unobstructed views of the spectacular fireworks displays. Your package will also come with free-flow champagne! But if you want the full NDP 2024 experience, book the Celebrate Singapore staycation package, which gives you 20% off room rates for your second night, plus daily breakfast and three-course dinner for two.

Where: The Capitol Kempinski Hotel Singapore, 15 Stamford Rd, Singapore 178906

How much: $59++ per person. Reserve your table here.

Local Food Parade @Stevens: National Day 2024 buffet

Novotel Singapore on Stevens celebrates National Day with month-long festivities filled with beloved local dishes. The Local Food Parade @ Stevens will feature over 50 iconic hawker dishes for one night only on National Day itself! Some highlights include Janggkut Katong Laksa, Original Serangoon Hokkien Mee, Rochor Original Beancurd, Heng Kee Curry Noodles, He Zhong Carrot Cake and more. Enjoy nostalgic flavours from Uncle Ice Cream and Kacang Puteh Uncle for dessert. The buffet, priced at $59 per person, includes a live telecast of the National Day Parade, allowing you to enjoy local cuisine while tuning in. Stay till 8:30pm for performances from local artists and buskers. Plus, enjoy bottomless servings of the signature @Stevens Singlish Beer!

Do you share the same birthday as Singapore? If so, you can dine for free with every two paying adults!

Where: Novotel Singapore on Stevens, 28 Stevens Rd, Orchard District, Singapore 257878

How much: $59++ per adult. Reserve your table here.

National Day Concert 2024 @ Gardens by The Bay

The Gardens by The Bay and Mediacorp National Day Concert is back for its sixth edition this year, with plenty of activities to celebrate Singapore’s 59th birthday. With the theme ‘Our Home, Our Heart, Our Singapore’, this year’s concert will be headlined by local talent Olivia Ong and will feature plenty of other homegrown talents, including Benjamin Kheng, who sang the NDP 2024 theme song! Aside from musical performances, there will also be plenty of exciting activities for the families, including go-kart races, carnival games, and roving acts from stilt walkers and roving jugglers. Stay till the end for the event highlight, where vibrant fireworks fill up the night sky against the gorgeous Supertree backdrop! More information here.

When: 4 August 2024, 7:30pm – 10pm (doors open 4:30pm)

Where: The Meadow, Gardens by the Bay

How much: Free!

Singapore Flyer: National Day 2024 Moonlight Flight

Singapore Flyer is celebrating National Day 2024 with a special Moonlight Flight, a first-of-its-kind overnight flight! This one-day-only event takes place from 9 August, 11pm to 10 August, 8am. Tickets go for just $25 per person, and Singapore Citizens and Permanent Residents born in August can enjoy free entry to the Moonlight Flight with every paying guest! All tickets will also give you free admission to the Time Capsule, an interactive journey that depicts Singapore’s past, present and future. To add to the festivities, there will also be a night market featuring a variety of F&B options and ample seating, making it one of the perfect places to watch the fireworks!

Where: Singapore Flyer, 30 Raffles Ave., Singapore 039803

How much: $25, purchase your tickets here.

Experience the NDP Fireworks in Style at JW Marriott Singapore South Beach!

Take the front seat and witness the spectacular NDP fireworks display over the Marina Bay skyline from the comfort of JW Marriott Singapore South Beach’s Premier Marina Bay Room and Suites! The spacious, designer-led décor room with a “floating” king-size bed is perfect for a family staycation. Guests can also watch the glittering fireworks up close from the Flow18 Sky Garden and swimming pool. During this celebratory period, indulge in the signature Chefs-on-Show Seafood Buffet at Beach Road Kitchen. Enjoy an array of Singaporean flavours with a culinary spread of international and local delights, including fresh seafood on ice, Bak Kwa pizza, chilli crab pasta, delectable durian treats for dessert, and more.

When: From 8 – 11 August 2024

Where: JW Marriott Singapore South Beach, 30 Beach Road, Singapore 189763

How much: Dinner (8 – 11 August): $108++; Lunch (9 August): $108++; Brunch (11 August): $118++

Book your staycation here and buffet table here

NDP 2024 @ Pororo Park Singapore: Mascot parade, carnival games, live streams

Pororo Park Singapore is hosting a special National Day 2024 celebration with an evening packed with fun activities! On 9 August from 6pm – 9pm, Pororo Park Singapore transforms into its own NDP 2024 with carnival games, balloon sculpting, Pororo & Friends tattoos, a mascot parade, and more. Enjoy live streaming of the NDP 2024, and since Pororo Park is located in Marina Square, there will be a special fireworks viewing segment where you can watch the stunning display live! Your little ones will also receive a special goodie bag worth $100, filled with Pororo merchandise, snacks, and vouchers.

Buy two admission tickets and get a Pororo merchandise of your choice for only $5.90! Plus LITE membership for 1 Adult + 1 Child is going for just $59! These promotions are valid from 1 – 31 August 2024.

Where: Pororo Park Singapore, Raffles Blvd, Marina Square, Singapore 039594

How much: from $69 (1 adult + 1 child). Ticket sales begin 8 July, purchase your tickets here.

NTUC x NDP Bay Celebrations

NTUC will be hosting its first large-scale NDP event as part of the extended National Day Parade 2024 celebrations at the Promontory @ Marina Bay. This event, NTUC’s biggest in over a decade, will take place on 3 and 9 August and will consist of live musical performances, a live broadcast of the NDP 2024, the state flag flypast, the “Salute to the Nation” bomb burst by the Republic of Singapore Air Force, the presidential gun salute sail-past, the Total Defence 40 dynamic defence display’s high-speed chase, and a fireworks display. Attendees will receive an NDP fun pack, and there will be a photo booth, interactive installations, and more. More info here.

When: 3 & 9 August, 3pm – 10pm

Where: Promontory @ Marina Bay

How much: Balloting is now closed.

National Day 2024 Celebrations at One Punggol

Good news for north-easties, because plenty of National Day celebrations are popping up! Celebrations will take place on two separate days with plenty of activities for the whole family. On 3 August, look forward to various activities, including stage performances, craft workshops that include making your very own Merlion plushies, movie screenings, arcade games and even bouncy castles! There’ll also be a sing-along segment, where you can show your patriotism by singing to your favourite NDP tunes. On 9 August, there’ll be plenty of live screening of NDP 2024. However, the highlight would have to be the State Flag Flypast and the Six F-16s Flypast that’ll pass through the Punggol district! Stay tuned to One Punggol’s Facebook page for updates!

When: 3 & 9 August

Where: One Punggol, 1 Punggol Dr., Singapore 828629

How much: Free!

MAJULAH FIESTA 2024: National Day Celebrations at Singapore Sports Hub

The Singapore Sports Hub brings back its National Day festivities this year with plenty of activities across three weeks! With the theme: ‘Together We Play, As One United People,’ there will be several aspects to ensure everyone’s at their patriotic best. Try a new sport at the Sports Tryouts, or get your groove on at the Majulah Fiesta Fitness Party. You can even bring your furry friends along for Pets Play Day. Some other programme highlights include the Lion City Dance Convention, the Active Health Fitness Challenge, and the live telecast of the NDP 2024, flypast and fireworks on 9 August! Check out the full itinerary of programmes here.

When: 27 July – 11 August

Where: Singapore Sports Hub

How much: Free!

National Day 2024 Celebrations at Community Centres

National Day celebrations kick off a week early at several heartland locations in Singapore, featuring various exciting weekend activities for the whole family. From carnivals and fitness events to durian parties and even fireworks, these heartland festivities are perfect for getting into the National Day spirit! Check out the full list of events here and stay updated through the social media platforms of the different heartlands.

When: from 3 August

Where: Various locations

How much: Free!

We will be updating this page with more information on the NDP 2024 events and side activities when more information is released.
